page.title: 07The Development of Old Hall
page.content: There is a large Horse Chestnut tree on the corner of Old Hall Road between the Barns Community Centre and the new pub.It stands there tall and strong branches waving in the breeze.It has probably been there a few hundred years.If it could only talk what a story it could tell.When it was a seedling the land all around was used for farming and hunting,the pub was still a farmhouse,the barn had cows in it and a great family lived in the Old Hall.Time passed people came and went. In 1940 when the tree was reaching maturity thousands of men came and camped around the Old Hall.They all belonged to Burtonwood Air Base.The place was crowded,all was hustle and bustle and the peace was continually shattered by the noise of large aircraft landing and taking off close by.
